These chapters (Isaiah 40:12-66) form a group corresponding with Isaiah chapters 1-5; and, like them, consist of exhortations and prophecies, while they are set in contrast with them, being promissory instead of reprehensory. Their subjects, as respectively repeated, will be seen in the Structure A below. They look beyond the Captivity.

Isaiah 40:12-66. EXHORTATIONS: PROMISSORY AND PROPHETIC.

(Alternation and Introversion.)
